member.name: T:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticsearchExtensions
member.summary: Adds the WriteTo.Elasticsearch() extension method to .

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticsearchExtensions.Elasticsearch(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions)
member.summary:
Adds a sink that writes log events as documents to an Elasticsearch index. This works great with the Kibana web interface when using the default settings.
By passing in the BufferBaseFilename, you make this into a durable sink. Meaning it will log to disk first and tries to deliver to the Elasticsearch server in the background.
member.remarks: Make sure to have a sensible mapping in your Elasticsearch indexes. You can automatically create one by specifying this in the options.
member.param: Options for the sink.
Provides options specific to the Elasticsearch sink

member.summary: Overload to allow basic configuration through AppSettings.
member.param: Options for the sink.
A comma or semi column separated list of URIs for Elasticsearch nodes.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink. Ignored when is specified.
A switch allowing the pass-through minimum level to be changed at runtime.
A comma or semi column separated list of key value pairs of headers to be added to each elastic http request

member.summary: Overload to allow basic configuration through AppSettings.
member.param: Options for the sink.
A comma or semi column separated list of URIs for Elasticsearch nodes.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink. Ignored when is specified.
A switch allowing the pass-through minimum level to be changed at runtime.
A comma or semi column separated list of key value pairs of headers to be added to each elastic http request
The connection timeout (in seconds) when sending bulk operations to elasticsearch (defaults to 5).
Specifies how failing emits should be handled.

The maximum number of events that will be held in-memory while waiting to ship them to Elasticsearch. Beyond this limit, events will be dropped. The default is 100,000. Has no effect on durable log shipping.
Name the Pipeline where log events are sent to sink. Please note that the Pipeline should be existing before the usage starts.
When set to true the sink will register an index template for the logs in elasticsearch.
When using the AutoRegisterTemplate feature, this allows to set the Elasticsearch version. Depending on the version, a template will be selected. Defaults to pre 5.0.
When using the AutoRegisterTemplate feature, this allows you to overwrite the template in Elasticsearch if it already exists. Defaults to false
Specifies the option on how to handle failures when writing the template to Elasticsearch. This is only applicable when using the AutoRegisterTemplate option.
Optionally set this value to the name of the index that should be used when the template cannot be written to ES.
The default number of shards.
The default number of replicas.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.DefaultJsonFormatter
member.summary: Formats log events in a simple JSON structure. Instances of this class are safe for concurrent access by multiple threads.
member.remarks: Migrated from the original Serilog.Formatting.Json.JsonFormatter implementation.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.DefaultJsonFormatter.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Construct a .
member.param: If true, the properties of the event will be written to the output without enclosing braces. Otherwise, if false, each event will be written as a well-formed JSON object.
A string that will be written after each log event is formatted. If null, will be used. Ignored if is true.
If true, the message will be rendered and written to the output as a property named RenderedMessage.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.DefaultJsonFormatter.Format(Serilog.Events.LogEvent,System.IO.TextWriter)

member.param: The event to format.
The output.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSink.HandleException(System.Exception,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Serilog.Events.LogEvent})
member.summary: Handles the exceptions.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions
member.summary: Provides ElasticsearchSink with configurable options

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.AutoRegisterTemplate
member.summary: When set to true the sink will register an index template for the logs in elasticsearch. This template is optimized to deal with serilog events

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.AutoRegisterTemplateVersion
member.summary: When using the feature, this allows to set the Elasticsearch version. Depending on the version, a template will be selected. Defaults to pre 5.0.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.RegisterTemplateFailure
member.summary: Specifies the option on how to handle failures when writing the template to Elasticsearch. This is only applicable when using the AutoRegisterTemplate option.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.TemplateName
member.summary: When using the feature this allows you to override the default template name. Defaults to: serilog-events-template

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.GetTemplateContent
member.summary: When using the feature, this allows you to override the default template content. If not provided, a default template that is optimized to deal with Serilog events is used.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.OverwriteTemplate
member.summary: When using the feature, this allows you to overwrite the template in Elasticsearch if it already exists. Defaults to: false

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.NumberOfShards
member.summary: When using the feature, this allows you to override the default number of shards. If not provided, this will default to the default number_of_shards configured in Elasticsearch.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.NumberOfReplicas
member.summary: When using the feature, this allows you to override the default number of replicas. If not provided, this will default to the default number_of_replicas configured in Elasticsearch.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.ModifyConnectionSettings
member.summary: Connection configuration to use for connecting to the cluster.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.IndexFormat
member.summary: The index name formatter. A string.Format using the DateTimeOffset of the event is run over this string. defaults to "logstash-{0:yyyy.MM.dd}"

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.DeadLetterIndexName
member.summary: Optionally set this value to the name of the index that should be used when the template cannot be written to ES. defaults to "deadletter-{0:yyyy.MM.dd}"

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.TypeName
member.summary: The default elasticsearch type name to use for the log events. Defaults to: logevent.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.PipelineNameDecider
member.summary: Function to decide which Pipeline to use for the LogEvent

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.PipelineName
member.summary: Name the Pipeline where log events are sent to sink. Please note that the Pipeline should be existing before the usage starts.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.BatchPostingLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of events to post in a single batch. Defaults to: 50.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.Period
member.summary: The time to wait between checking for event batches. Defaults to 2 seconds.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.FormatProvider
member.summary: Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.Connection
member.summary: Allows you to override the connection used to communicate with elasticsearch.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The connection timeout (in milliseconds) when sending bulk operations to elasticsearch (defaults to 5000).

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.InlineFields
member.summary: When true fields will be written at the root of the json document.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.MinimumLogEventLevel
member.summary: The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink. Ignored when LoggingLevelSwitch is specified.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.LevelSwitch
member.summary: A switch allowing the pass-through minimum level to be changed at runtime.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.Serializer
member.summary: When passing a serializer unknown object will be serialized to object instead of relying on their ToString representation

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.ConnectionPool
member.summary: The connectionpool describing the cluster to write event to

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.IndexDecider
member.summary: Function to decide which index to write the LogEvent to

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.BufferBaseFilename
member.summary: Optional path to directory that can be used as a log shipping buffer for increasing the reliability of the log forwarding.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.BufferFileSizeLimitBytes
member.summary: The maximum size, in bytes, to which the buffer log file for a specific date will be allowed to grow. By default no limit will be applied.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.BufferLogShippingInterval
member.summary: The interval between checking the buffer files.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.CustomFormatter
member.summary: Customizes the formatter used when converting log events into ElasticSearch documents. Please note that the formatter output must be valid JSON :)

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.CustomDurableFormatter
member.summary: Customizes the formatter used when converting log events into the durable sink. Please note that the formatter output must be valid JSON :)

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.EmitEventFailure
member.summary: Specifies how failing emits should be handled.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.FailureSink
member.summary: Sink to use when Elasticsearch is unable to accept the events. This is optionally and depends on the EmitEventFailure setting.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.FailureCallback
member.summary: A callback which can be used to handle logevents which are not submitted to Elasticsearch like when it is unable to accept the events. This is optionally and depends on the EmitEventFailure setting.

member.name: P:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of events that will be held in-memory while waiting to ship them to Elasticsearch. Beyond this limit, events will be dropped. The default is 100,000. Has no effect on durable log shipping.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Configures the elasticsearch sink defaults

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.#ctor(Elasticsearch.Net.IConnectionPool)
member.summary: Configures the elasticsearch sink
member.param: The connectionpool to use to write events to

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Uri})
member.summary: Configures the elasticsearch sink
member.param: The nodes to write to

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkOptions.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Configures the elasticsearch sink
member.param: The node to write to

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.EmitEventFailureHandling
member.summary: Sepecifies options for handling failures when emitting the events to Elasticsearch. Can be a combination of options.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.EmitEventFailureHandling.WriteToSelfLog
member.summary: Send the error to the SelfLog

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.EmitEventFailureHandling.WriteToFailureSink
member.summary: Write the events to another sink. Make sure to configure this one.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.EmitEventFailureHandling.ThrowException
member.summary: Throw the exception to the caller.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.EmitEventFailureHandling.RaiseCallback
member.summary: The failure callback function will be called when the event cannot be submitted to Elasticsearch.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.RegisterTemplateRecovery
member.summary: Specifies what to do when the template could not be created. This can mean that your data is not correctly indexed, so you might want to handle this failure.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.RegisterTemplateRecovery.IndexAnyway
member.summary: Ignore the issue and keep indexing. This is the default option.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.RegisterTemplateRecovery.IndexToDeadletterIndex
member.summary: When the template cannot be registered, move the events to the deadletter index instead.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.RegisterTemplateRecovery.FailSink
member.summary: When the template cannot be registered, throw an exception and fail the sink.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ElasticsearchSinkState.RegisterTemplateIfNeeded
member.summary: Register the elasticsearch index template if the provided options mandate it.

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.AutoRegisterTemplateVersion.ESv2
member.summary: Elasticsearch version <= 2.4

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.AutoRegisterTemplateVersion.ESv5
member.summary: Elasticsearch version <= version 5.6

member.name: F:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.AutoRegisterTemplateVersion.ESv6
member.summary: Elasticsearch version >= version 6.0

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.Elasticsearch.ExceptionAsObjectJsonFormatter
member.summary:
A JSON formatter which plays nice with Kibana, by serializing any exception into an exception object, instead of relying on an array of the exceptions and the inner exception.
Note that using this formatter comes at the cost that the exception tree with inner exceptions can grow deep.

member.param: If true, the properties of the event will be written to the output without enclosing braces. Otherwise, if false, each event will be written as a well-formed JSON object.
A string that will be written after each log event is formatted. If null, will be used. Ignored if is true.
If true, the message will be rendered and written to the output as a property named RenderedMessage.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
Inject a serializer to force objects to be serialized over being ToString()
When set to true values will be written at the root of the json document

member.summary: Writes out the attached exception
